citation.article-title: Litoricolaceae fam. nov., to include Litoricola lipolytica gen. nov., sp. nov., a marine bacterium belonging to the order Oceanospirillales
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Litoricola (Li.to.ri′co.la. L. n. litus -oris seashore; L. suff. -cola from L. masc. or fem. n. incola inhabitant; N.L. fem. n. Litoricola inhabitant of the seashore).
Acid is not produced from glucose fermentation.
The predominant fatty acids are C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH, C18 : 1ω7c and C10 : 0 3-OH .
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 57.9 mol%.
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the family Litoricolaceae within the order Oceanospirillales.
The type species of the genus is Litoricola lipolytica.
